thread.title: Top 5 Must See Places In Louisiana
thread.title_full: Top 5 Must See Places In Louisiana

author: admin
title: Top 5 Must See Places In Louisiana
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > Top 5 Must See Places In Louisiana Top 5 Must See Places In Louisiana   28, 2015 Pin It 
Louisiana is one of the key attractions for people who love to travel to different places. There are great scopes of kayaking, boating canoeing and fishing offered at Louisiana and that too at anytime of the year. 
Apart from this, visitors to this beautiful place can also enjoy camping, bird watching, hiking and biking. The place is also famous for Cajun meals, water tours for seeing crocodiles and for taking a good glimpse of history. 
There are few must see places in Louisiana, which will allow to enjoy the gorgeous and the comfortable weather of this area. Must See Places in Louisiana During Your Visit 
Some of the must to see places in Louisiana during your visit have been described below: New Orleans French Quarter 
The French Quarter serves as the old part of New Orleans and it is quite popular for its old buildings that look simply stunning even though they date back to around 300 years. These buildings feature balconies made of wrought iron. The city is also famous for it jazz music association. Mardi Gras World Photo Credits: mardigrasworld.com 
Mardi Gras World is one of the popular attractions in Louisiana. This is the place where floats for the famous Mardi Gras Parade in New Orleans are made. 
Mardi Gras Parade is the biggest event on the annual calendar of Louisiana which takes place on the Fat Tuesday before Ash Wednesday (i.e. generally in February). This is a very colorful event with a plethora of street celebrations, balls and parades. Melrose Plantation Photo Credits: squarespace.com 
Melrose Plantation located at Natchitoches was previously called Yucca Plantation. This place is filled with beautiful buildings and gardens that have been preserved by John Hampton Henry and Camie, his wife. Many artists and writers have visited Melrose Plantations as guests. Avery Island Photo Credits: M L Stracener 
Avery Island is one of the most popular and the must see places in Louisiana. Avery Island is located approximately 140 miles away from New Orleans and it is known for its popular Tabasco sauce. The island appears in the form of a wonderful paradise which is surrounded by marshes and swamps. Jean Lafitte National Historical Park And Preserve Photo Credits: nps.gov 
Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve is the place where you can absorb and even enjoy the cultural mix in Louisiana. Here you can have an in-depth knowledge of Cajun tradition. 
Here in this Park you can enjoy the beauty of wildlife at Barataria Preserve, walk in the footsteps of American troops that fought against British invasion in 1815, enjoy the view of alligators on the banks of Bayou.
